statement:
Let $H$ be a unitary space, $T$ be a self-adjoint linear operator and
$\mu\geq 0$. If $\vert{\left\langle Tv,v\right\rangle}\vert\leq \mu
\|v\|^2$ for all $v\in H$ then $T$ is a bounded operator and
$\|T\|\leq \mu$.

We will show that
${\left\Vert Tv \right\Vert}\leq \mu{\left\Vert v \right\Vert}$ for all
$v\in H$. This is trivial if ${\left\Vert Tv \right\Vert}$ or
${\left\Vert v \right\Vert}$ is zero, so assume they are not. Let
$\lambda$ be any positive number. $$\begin{aligned}
{\left\Vert Tv \right\Vert}^2 & = {\left\langle Tv,Tv\right\rangle}\\
&=\frac{1}{4}\left[ {\left\langle T\left(\lambda v +
\frac{1}{\lambda}Tv\right),\left(\lambda v +
\frac{1}{\lambda}Tv\right)\right\rangle} - {\left\langle T\left(\lambda v -
\frac{1}{\lambda}Tv\right),\left(\lambda v
-\frac{1}{\lambda}Tv\right)\right\rangle}\right]\\
&\leq \frac{\mu}{4}\left[{\left\Vert \lambda v + \frac{1}{\lambda}Tv \right\Vert}^2
+{\left\Vert \lambda v - \frac{1}{\lambda}Tv \right\Vert}^2 \right]\\
&\leq\frac{\mu}{2}\left[\lambda^2{\left\Vert v \right\Vert}^2 +
\frac{1}{\lambda^2}{\left\Vert Tv \right\Vert}^2 \right]\end{aligned}$$
Now if we put $\displaystyle \lambda^2 =
\frac{{\left\Vert Tv \right\Vert}}{{\left\Vert v \right\Vert}}$ we get
${\left\Vert Tv \right\Vert}^2 \leq
\mu{\left\Vert Tv \right\Vert}{\left\Vert v \right\Vert}$ hence
${\left\Vert Tv \right\Vert}\leq \mu {\left\Vert v \right\Vert}$.

**Reference:**

F. Riesz and B. Sz-Nagy, *Functional Analysis*, F. Ungar Publishing,
1955, chap VI.
names: $\vert\langle Tv,v \rangle\vert \leq {\mu} \Vert v \Vert ^2$ for all $v$ implies $\Vert T \Vert \leq {\mu}$
